column4: hey guys, now I have a question... I've tried installing the NDISwrapper for my (don't pull your hair out now) broadcom wlan for my Compaq V2000Z.  I've been following the instructions at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HowToSetUpNdiswrapper and am stuck at line 5.   I don't see the wlan0 in my Sys -> Admin -> Networking spot.
where do i go from here?
you made progress!  an hour ago you were stuck at line 4!  Been there, done that, but, you did it quicker!
where can i get that magazine????
then if you got it set up.... can you help me??? *wink wink wink*
I didnt' see anything about desktop and fileserver options in here https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HowToSetUpNdiswrapper

I thought that the VESA driver is the OLDER video standard, and actully, if I want really good resolution, etc. from a Linux listed peice of video hardware, then, I should use the driver for that piece of listed hardware... such as an Nvidia card driver, instead of the VESA driver, but, mayhap some Xpert can chime in?
I have a very, very new laptop and my particular card.. the ati 200m, can't run anything including a radeon driver... it has to use the VESA
it's not perfect... such as I can't standby or hibernate with out serious problems... but crap, as long as I can run linux instead of windows I'm a happy camper
i just need my wireless card to work so that i can work remotely at my client sitesw
that's why I was asking for your help in getting it up and running
re: using the VESA driver, do you understand now why it works?
right on... and because it's a desktop already it's an easier workaround :)
yeah, been there. VESA is great for my servers, or, when I don't really know what it is, and the installer selects it forme... anything to get up!
